bib_record.title: Cross section measurements of proton and deuteron induced formation of 103Ag in natural palladium

free_txt: CGR 560 cyclotron of Brussels
The uncertainty of the primary beam 0.3 MeV.
The enrgy uncertainty in the last foil of a thich stack
was 1.7 MeV for protons.
Total errors were given. Correction of the beam
was made using the monitor reactions.
Number of target nuclei       5%
Detector efficiency           5%
Beam intensity                5%
Statistical error           1-5%
CGR 560 cyclotron of Brussels
Stacked target technique was used. Initial energies:
20.5 and 15.1 MeV for deuterons and 37.3, 28.5 and
15.9 MeV for protons.
Ti, Cu and Ni were used as monitor foils.
Beam intensity was 100-200nA and was also measured in
Faraday cup.
Five irradiations were done.
High resolution gamma spectrometry was applied without
chemical separation. Spectra were measured after the
total decay of the short lived isomer states.
Energy degradation was calculated by using the
polynomial approximation of Andersen and Ziegler.
Energy scale and beam intensity along the stacks were
corrected according to the applied monitor reactions.
Decay data were taken from R.B. Firestone
Table of Isotopes.
chapter 4
Targets were high purity natural Pd foils of 12.14 and
7.99 microns from GoodFellow.
